Competition: The craft brewing industry is highly competitive, and breaking into the market can be difficult.
Quality control: Ensuring that the beer produced meets high standards of quality can be a challenge, especially for a new brewery.
Distribution: Getting the beer into the hands of consumers can be difficult, especially for a new brewery with limited distribution channels.
Marketing: Craft breweries often have unique and niche products, which can make marketing them more challenging.
Regulations: Craft breweries must navigate a complex web of regulations, including alcohol content, labeling, and distribution laws.
